text: Ugh, is it morning already?
I feel like I just went to bed.
Yeah, it's morning.
The alarm's been going off for a while now.
We should probably get up.
Another busy day ahead.
I know, I know. But five more minutes wouldn’t hurt, right?
So cozy here.
You always say that, and then we end up rushing.
But I get it.
Mornings are tough.
Let’s make a deal, five more minutes, and then we’ll start the day.
Deal.
You know, I've been thinking about changing our morning routine.
Maybe adding some stretches or a quick workout.
It might help us wake up better.
That's not a bad idea.
So, what should I call you?
You can call me Sara! And you are...?
Mike.
So, Sara, is this your first time at the gym?
Yes. It's my first time at the gym today.
I'm a bit nervous.
Don't worry.
The gym can be a little confusing at first, but it’s fun!
I hope so. What should I start with?
You can begin with some light cardio.
Try the treadmill or the stationary bike.
Sounds good.
How do I use the treadmill?
Just step on, press the start button, and choose your speed.
It's pretty easy.
Okay, I'll try that.
What about weights?
I've never used them before.
For weights, start with small ones.
Use machines that show you how to do the exercises.
I'm afraid I might not do it right.
No worries.
The trainers are there to help.
You can always ask them for advice.
That’s good to know. How long should I work out?
To start with, try 30 minutes.
Mixed cardio with some light weights.
Thanks for the tips! I feel a bit better now.
You’re welcome! You’ll do great.
Just take it slow and enjoy.
I will. Thanks for the help!
Anytime! Have a great workout!
Good morning.
Morning, Bella! You seem a bit tired.
Yes, I was up pretty late working on my annual report.
Is it due today?
Yes, I have to turn it in this morning.
So, have you finished it yet?
All ready?
Great job, my friend.
Now sit down and have something to eat.
I don't really have an appetite right now.
You should really eat something! I'll make you some eggs, how about that?
I guess so.
Eggs are nutritious and give you lots of energy! You'll need it to go to work!
Yes. You're right.
So, would you prefer your eggs scrambled or boiled?
I'd go for boiled ones!
Hard boiled or runny?
Um... Hard boiled, please!
Got it! I'll add some fresh salad too!
Thanks, girl!
By the way, I'm making sandwiches for lunch. Do you want me to pack some for you?
That would be nice! Your salmon sandwiches are always top-notch!
I know, but today I'm making chicken sandwiches.
Why the switch up?
Because we ran out of dill sauce. My salmon sandwiches wouldn't be the same without it!
I'll stop by the gas station later.
Do you want me to grab some for you?
That would be great! If possible, please get the one from Tilson's.
What if they don't have it?
Then anything else was fine.
Got it.
Whoa, slow down!
Where’s the fire?
No fire.
Just me being late-again.
Oh, Jake.
Yeah. It's me.
What a coincidence!
You know.. I'm...
Let me guess.
You're going to be late.
Bingo.
My breakfast was not as expected.
Now I'm running purely on caffeine and regret.
Classic Emily.
Want to try my bagel?
I bought it from a very famous shop nearby, and you won't regret trying it.
Ugh, I love those, but I have a meeting in 15 minutes.
My boss will kill me if I show up with garlic breath.
Besides, I have my own breakfast.
Fair enough.
Go, go!
May the subway be in your favor.
Thanks, Jake.
And may your bagel always be perfectly toasted.
She’s definitely going to spill that coffee.
Hey, Lena, want to join us for lunch? We’re heading to the break room.
Is it... lunchtime already?
Oh right! I wasn’t sure what the lunch rules were.
Don’t worry, there are no “rules.” Just don’t steal someone’s yogurt.
Good tip. I brought leftovers. Chicken… something.
The microwave’s a bit grumpy. Remember to hit it twice and pray.
Oh no… did I break it?
Nope. That’s its love language.
What's up, Charli! Lunch?
Yeah! Oh, Ethan, this is Lena!
Hey, you’re new, right? I’m Ethan. First-day survivor?
Yep, still alive so far. Nice to meet you.
That smells good. Want to trade half for half a sandwich?
Tempting, but I’ll eat my mystery meat.
So Lena, how’s everything so far? Not too overwhelming?
It's better than I expected.
A little nervous, though.
Give it till Friday. You’ll be correcting our mistakes.
Hah! True. I once sent a file to the wrong client… twice.
Well, that’s… comforting.
Snack? Or are you one of those healthy people?
I try… but chips don’t take no for an answer.
They’re hard to say no to. Just one turns into ten.
…You guys always eat here?
Yeah, unless it’s sunny. Then we sneak out to the park across the street.
Or if someone forgets their lunch and begs for fries.
Stick with us, and you’ll never eat alone. Not that we’re clingy or anything.
Thanks. It’s nice not feeling like the “new kid” at the lunch table.
To mystery chicken and new teammates!
Ha ha ha!
Cheers.
Why are you guys here?
Because it's coffee time! Do you want to grab a cup?
Sure.
So, did you hear about the new promotion?
No I didn't.
What promotion?
They are promoting Sarah to team leader.
I heard she did a great job on the last project.
That’s awesome! Sarah worked really hard.
She deserves it.
Yes, she does! I remember how she stayed late to finish that report.
Exactly! She always goes the extra mile.
I think she will be a great leader.
I agree. I’m excited to see how she will lead the team.
Do you think she will change anything in our meetings?
Maybe! I hope she keeps it fun and light.
Our meetings can be a bit boring sometimes.
Right! A little more energy would be nice.
Yes, I hope she brings new ideas too.
I think she will.
Okay, what do you want for dinner?
Cheese.
Cheese is not an option.
So something with a lot of cheese.
I consider that no dinner for Mike today.
Just kidding! How about a burger?
Ugh, I would rather not touch the grill today.
Fine. What about pasta?
What kind?
I'm craving some lasagna.
Ugh, that’s way too much work after a long day.
So, what do you think?
Something healthier and easier.
Like.
Like some salmon and side salad.
That sounds boring...
Hey, it's better than your turkey sandwiches.
I take pride in my turkey sandwiches.
Right, right.
But I'm cooking today, so I get to decide.
Actually, I was about to volunteer to cook.
Oh. That's odd.
What's the occasion?
I'm hanging out with Jake after dinner.
Okay. So, are you cleaning up first?
I was hoping you would.
Oh. Were you?
That's cute.
Look, I’ll cook. You clean. Fair deal.
Are you actually going to cook?
Not just “supervise” while I do all the work?
This time, I promise.
Should I be worried about food poisoning?
Relax.
I've watched enough Master Chef to know how to whip up a decent meal.
Last time you cooked something decent, I was stuck in the bathroom for an hour.
Not this time, I swear.
Ugh... So, I'll just have to clean?
Exactly.
Hmm. Fine.
You won't regret this.
I already do.
Have a little faith.
I have faith that I’ll be ordering takeout.
That's rude.
That's accurate.
Mom, I'm home!
Welcome home, Sarah! How was your day?
It was fine, I guess. Hey Tom, what are you doing in the kitchen?
Can you see? I'm helping mom cook dinner?
You're helping mom cook?
What's the occasion?
Did you watch too much Master Chef, last night?
I want to learn how to cook.
Great job bro.
Let's see.
What are you cooking?
What's this called? Mom.
It's meat pie, sweetie.
It's meat pie!
Amazing! It's my favorite! Can I have a bite?
Not now, Sarah! It's not done yet!
Plus, you haven't washed your hands!
Your brother's right! Go wash your hands, Sarah!
Alright, alright, chefs! I'll go wash my hands now!
Hey, wait! Could you help me take out the trash, please?
Right now, Mom? Isn't it Tom's turn to take out the trash?
Can't you see he's helping me cook?
And you haven't washed your hands anyway!
Ugh... Okay!
Thank you, sister! I'll make sure your delicious meat pie is ready when you get back!
You better.
This is crazy!
What's the plan for tomorrow?
We need to get this car ready for tomorrow morning.
We still have to put on the new parts and clean it up.
Everything needs to be done before the exhibition
so we can be shown there.
This is going to be a long night.
I can't believe we thought we could do this in one night.
Okay, let's make a plan.
If we can finish the parts by 11 PM,
we can take a quick break and then clean and polish the car.
Okay.
I'll do my best for my wife and daughter.
They must love you a lot.
Let’s keep it up!
Look who's here! Welcome, kids!
It’s so good to see you both. How was your trip?
It was fine, Grandpa. We’re glad to be here.
Yeah, it’s been a while. We missed you!
We missed you too.
Come in and make yourselves at home.
Are you hungry? We made your favorite cookies.
Chocolate chip? You’re the best, Grandma!
Can I have one now?
Of course! Sit down first, and I will bring you some cookies!
So, what have you two been up to lately?
School's been busy, but it's going well.
I've been playing a lot of football.
We had a big game last week.
That sounds exciting!
Did you win?
Yes, we did! It was awesome.
That’s great! We’re so proud of you.
What about you two? How have you been?
We’ve been good. Keeping busy with the garden and some new hobbies.
What kind of hobbies?
I've been learning to paint, and grandma is trying her hand at knitting.
That sounds fun.
Can we see what you've made?
Of course! We’d love to show you.
This visit is going to be so much fun.
We’re glad you think so. Let’s make the most of it.
Absolutely! We’re happy to be here.
We're happy you're here too.
Now, let's enjoy those cookies.
Is there anything more I need to do around the house, Mom?
There are many things to do such as washing clothes, taking out the trash, sweeping, mopping, vacuuming.
Wait a second.
Why do you want to do housework today?
I want to make more money. I'm saving money.
For what?
Well, it's a secret.
Oh, okay.
There's a lot of laundry to do.
I will wash the clothes now.
They must be cleaned, folded and stored.
I got it.
Let me know if you want to do anything else after that.
Okay, I have a lot more work to do.
I am curious.
What are you actually saving money for?
Just promise me you won't tell anyone about this, okay Mom?
I promise.
I want to give Dad a new watch for his birthday.
Well, that's great. He would love it.
Only a few weeks until Dad's birthday. I need to get more chores done.
Alan, you're a good child.
Hey, Billy. Do you want to go to the movies after school?
No, I need to do housework first.
I didn't do them all last week, so I'll have to finish them all today.
So what do we need to do?
I'm going to rake the lawn and tidy my room, take out the trash.
Wow, that's a lot to do.
I know. And so I need to hurry home to do the housework.
What will you do first?
I'll clean my room.
Have you ever seen my room?
It looks like a tornado went through it.
Why hadn't you cleaned it earlier?
I'm pretty lazy to clean up.
Do you have to do chores?
Yes, but I try to finish them as quickly as possible.
Now I have to spend the day of Friday doing housework.
That's unfortunate.
I want to go see a new movie with you.
Do you want to help me clean my bedroom?
No way, I'm going to have a good time on Friday afternoon.
All right. Have fun going to the movies.
Seema! Why do you spend so much time only on studies?
You should also learn household work.
Yes, father.
Your mother and I would like you to begin completing chores.
Will I get an allowance like Susie ?
Without a doubt.
First and foremost, when the playroom becomes cluttered, let's tell it is up.
Is there anything else?
You also need to clean the table.
These are simple.
As well as washing dishes.
Is it true that I have to do all of these things every day?
No. I want you to share these responsibilities with your sister.
You may both choose which ones to do.
That's unfair.
Why?
She'll choose the simplest ones for herself and assign the more difficult ones to me.
No, she will not.
You don't understand.
You don't know Suzy like I do.
I think I want to raise in my allowance.
Rest assured, you get what you deserve.
If I have to share duties with my sister, I'll be doing the most of the work.
What's wrong with you?
You look so sad.
Oh hi Mark. Our dog has gone missing. Someone opened the gate, and he was gone.
Oh no, that's bad. Let me help you find the dog.
Thank you so much. My kid is really unhappy right now.
Have you contacted any local dog shelters?
They said they haven't seen our dog.
They promised to contact me if they found our dog.
How can I identify your dog?
On the dog's neck was a collar with its name on it.
Our dog's name is Rusty.
That's great. Should we print some fliers to distribute around the neighborhood?
That is exactly what my wife is doing right now.
How old is your dog?
He's four years old, brown with white spots.
I know what he looks like.
Like this.
Right. But I'm just worried he's kidnapped or injured.
I get what you mean. He is a member of your family.
Yes, he is an important member of our family.
We adopted him when he was a puppy.
Phil, look behind you. Is that your dog?
Yeah. It's Rusty.
Can we have a dog, Dad?
We've talked about this before.
You said you would buy me a dog when I grow up.
Having a dog comes with a lot of responsibilities.
I know. I can take care of it.
You must walk him, feed him, wash him, and play with him.
I swear I'll do all of those things.
Alright, but I need to speak with your mother first.
Please don't do that.
You know she doesn't like dogs.
If you tell her, she won't agree to buy a dog.
That's because she's very afraid of dogs.
What makes her afraid of dogs?
When she was a youngster, she was bitten by a dog.
Oh, I see.
But what if we get a puppy?
We can train it not to bite.
Hmm... Okay. I will think about it.
Did you ever have a dog as a child, Dad?
Yes, but I wasn't old enough to take care of him then.
How old were you then?
12 years old.
Dad, I'm 13 years old now. I can take care of the dog.
All right.
I believe in you, son.
Hello, Alice. Do you know anyone who might want a dog?
What type of dog is it?
It is a Pug breed.
Why are you asking that?
We recently learned that our son is allergic to dogs.
Oh, really?
Every time our son plays with the dog, he sneezes and develops a rash.
That's awful.
We didn't realize Steven was allergic when he was a newborn,
but now that he's crawling about and playing with Buster, his symptoms have gotten worse.
I'm very sad to hear this.
You and Charlie have had Buster since he was a puppy.
I remember when all three of you moved in next door.
Right.
Buster is part of my family.
Buster has been with us for a long time,
but now Steven is allergic to dogs.
What about your family members?
Is there anyone in the family that could take Buster?
Then you may see him whenever you want.
I tried to convince my sister and relatives, but no one can take a dog right now.
Our children have all grown up and moved out. Stan and I are getting lonely.
Would you like me to take care of Buster for you?
Really?
My husband loves dogs, and Buster is such a good, loyal dog.
He hardly ever barks.
Isn't it necessary for you to talk to Stan first?
He'll say agree, I'm sure. He's been talking about getting a dog lately.
Thank you very much.
You can come to see Buster any time you want.
You're such a kind person.
Hello there, Cindy. What are you doing tomorrow?
I'll be working till 5 p.m..
I'm planning a party for my sister's birthday. Do you want to come?
Sure, I’d love to! What time does the party start?
It begins at 5 p.m..
Okay, I'll be a few minutes late. But don't worry, I'll try to be there as soon as I can.
No need to hurry. We will wait for you.
Where are you going to have it?
In my garden.
Oh, good. Can I bring anything?
There is no need to bring anything.
I want to give her a present.
What does she enjoy?
That isn't necessary.
I really want to give her a gift.
Does she enjoy music?
She enjoys music.
What genres of music does she enjoy?
Pop. Jazz, hip hop or classical music?
She enjoys pop music.
Okay, I've got an idea.
And what should we wear?
The main colors are white and beige.
I see. Thank you.
Excuse me, can you help me?
I’m looking for… uhh… what do you call it?
Oh. Baking powder?
Sure! It’s right here on this shelf.
Are you baking something today?
Yes, I’m trying to make a cake, but I’m missing a few things.
I also need… uhh... flour?
Yes, you got it right—flour!
It’s on the shelf below the baking powder shelf.
By the way, is this your first time baking?
Yes, and I'm so nervous.
My friend told me to wing it, but I'm not sure what that means.
Oh, It means to try without following exact steps or recipes.
Oh, interesting.
Thanks, I think I’ll give it a shot.
Sarah, do we really need five boxes of cereal?
Of course! They’re on sale!
But we only eat breakfast once a day, right?
True, but think of all the flavors!
You mean all the sugar?
Are you kidding me?
Just don't drink coffee after that.
Deal!
Oh, what about chips?
Chips?
I thought we came here to buy healthy food only!
Max, too much healthy is boring.
You should have cheat days for yourself.
What's a cheat day?
It’s when you eat less healthy food.
For example: cheese, hamburger, pizza and so on.
Having a few cheat days isn’t harmful to your health, Max.
I can't argue with that.
Let's get both.
You pick the chips, I’ll find the healthy stuff!
Hi there.
What can I get for you today?
Do you have any fresh smoothies?
Yes! We have strawberry, mango, and even a green detox one with spinach and kale.
Hmm, spinach and kale?
That sounds healthy, right?
Healthy... but maybe a little boring.
Well, If you're looking for something fun, we have a chocolate peanut butter smoothie.
Oh, It’s a bit of a treat!
Now that sounds like a cheat day in a cup!
Exactly! That’s the one I’m getting.
I’ll stick to something healthy.
I'll have the green detox smoothie.
Would you like a snack with that?
We have fresh baked cookies or a fruit salad.
I'll take the cookie. Of course.
I'll take the fruit salad, please.
Alright, I’ll get those ready for you.
Look at all these fresh vegetables!
Me too. Honey.
I love buying fresh produce; it just feels better, doesn’t it?
Yes, and look at the tomatoes.
They’re so red and ripe!
Let's buy some!
How much is this basket?
It's $10 for the whole basket.
Can we get it for $8?
How about $9?
They were just picked this morning!
You can't get fresher than that.
That’s a great deal! Let’s take it!
I'm thinking of making a big salad with all the fresh produce.
And, how about adding a few apples?
They’ll be a perfect snack later.
Thank you so much.
I can’t wait to make a healthy dinner tonight.
Oh, these magnets are so cute.
I want to buy one for my mom.
How much is this one?
It says $4.
Can you bargain here?
I think so! Let me try.
Hi! Can I get this for $3?
Hmm, how about $3.5?
What does “how about” mean?
Oh, it means they're giving you a different price.
Oh, I see.
They’re offering $3.5 instead of $4.
I think I'll take it at that price.
It's all too expensive, and my mom will love it.
Yes, plus it's unique.
You won't find this everywhere.
Do you think she'll like it?
I hope so.
I think it’s perfect for her!
Merry Christmas!
Hi! I’m looking for… uh, a good laptop for school.
but I don't know much about these.
No problem.
How can I help you?
Are you looking for something simple or more powerful?
I guess just something for studying, maybe some light gaming?
But not too expensive.
I understand this one here might be perfect.
It's cheap and great for studying.
Plus, it can handle some games too.
That sounds good.
But what does handle mean in this case?
“Handle” here means it can support gaming without any problems.
Ah, I got it!
Thank you for explaining.
I think I'll choose this one.
How do you feel about the conversations so far?
Are you understanding them well?
Have you tried speaking like the characters?
If you have, keep up the great work!
If not, don't worry, just take your time.
You've got this!
